text:
Desimartini IPL 2017 Auction, Live updates: Ben Stokes goes to RPS for record Rs 14.5 crores 
Catch live updates of the 2017 IPL Auction here. Ben Stokes became the highest paid international cricketer as he was snapped up by Rising Pune Supergiants for a record sum of Rs 14.5 crores. Follow live updates here cricket Updated: Feb 20, 2017 10:31 IST Siddharth Vishwanathan Hindustan Times Ben Stokes was snapped up for Rs 14.5 crores in the IPL Auction, a record sum for an international player. Catch live updates of the IPL Auction here.(Hindustan Times) 
Catch live updates of the 2017 IPL Auction here. Ben Stokes became the highest international player to be snapped up in the Indian Premier League as he went to Rising Pune Supergiants for a record sum of Rs 14.5 crore. Angelo Mathews and Eoin Morgan were also snapped up for Rs 2 crore. Catch live updates of 2017 IPLAuction here ( WHERETOSEELIVESTREAMING ) 
10:29 hrs IST: The fast bowlers are up next. Nathan Coulter-Nile is the first player in this set. He played for Delhi Daredevils in the 2016 edition. He is unsold . 
10:28 hrs IST : Johnson Charles goes unsold. Dinesh Chandimal is up next. He also goes unsold . 
10:27 hrs IST : Nicholas Pooran, the West Indies wicketkeeper, is up next. Mumbai Indians have bid for him. He is sold to Mumbai Indians for his base price of Rs 30 lakhs . 
10:25 hrs IST: Jonny Bairstow is up next. His base price is Rs 1.5 crores. He goes unsold . The auctioneer with a cheeky response, “ he is no longer friends with Ben Stokes .” Andre Fletcher, West Indies wicketkeeper, goes unsold. 
10:23 hrs IST : The wicketkeepers are up next for the auction. Ben Dunk is the first player in this set. His base price is Rs 30 lakhs. He is unsold . 
10:20 hrs IST: Stephen Fleming says, “There is an element of risk when spend big-time money, but we are ready to take that risk. We look strong on paper. It’s the top 8 that you really have to respect. You have got three captains so you have leadership. We have bowlers, allrounders in Mitch Marsh and Stokes.” 
10:15 hrs IST : Rising Pune Supergiants only have Rs 3 crore balance. Time for the other teams to cash in. 
10:12 hrs IST : Session highlights so far. Ben Stokes steals the show with record Rs 14.5 crore, Angelo Mathews and Eoin Morgan snapped up for their base price. Pawan Negi the highest Indian with Rs 1 crore. 
10:08 hrs IST : The big highlight of the session. Ben Stokes going for a record sum of Rs 14.5 crore , the most expensive international player ever. 
10:04 hrs IST : Sean Abbott goes unsold. Chris Jordan is next with a base price of Rs 50 lakh. He goes unsold . England’s Ben Stokes has become the highest bid international player in the IPLafter he went to Rising Pune Supergiants for Rs 14.5 crores. (AFP) 
10:03 hrs IST : Ben Stokes goes to RPSfor Rs 14.5 crore. He becomes the highest international player in the IPL , surpassing Shane Watson’s mark of Rs 9.5 crore. Corey Anderson goes to Delhi Daredevils for Rs 1 crore, his base price . 
10:00 hrs IST: Can Stokes break the record? Sunrisers Hyderabad are out of the fray. 
09:58 hrs IST : Delhi Daredevils and Kings XIPunjab, along with Sunrisers Hyderabad are in the fray now. Stokes has touched 13 crores. Now, Rising Pune Supergiants have bid and it has touched Rs 13.5 crores . Incredible. 
09:55 hrs IST : Delhi Daredevils have jumped in. Stokes’ price has touched 8 crore. It has touched 9 crores . He has touched 10 crores . 
09:53 hrs IST: Ben Stokes is the next player in the Rs 2 crore bracket. Mumbai Indians have bid for him. MIand RCBare bidding for him. His price has gone past 4 crores. He has gone past 5 crores 
09:52 hrs IST : Irfan Pathan is the next player. His base price is Rs 50 lakhs and he goes unsold . 
09:51 hrs IST : Very late bid for Angelo Mathews by Delhi Daredevils. He is sold to Delhi Daredevils for his base price of Rs 2 crore . 
09:49 hrs IST : Pawan Negi sold to RCB for Rs 1 crore . 
09:46 hrs IST: Rising Pune Supergiants and Gujarat Lions are opening up the bid. His price has gone up to over 50 lakhs. RPSis out. Royal Challengers Bangalore have jumped into the fray. Sunrisers Hyderabad have also jumped into the fray. His price has gone past Rs 1 crore. 
09:45 hrs IST: The next batch is up for grabs. Pawan Negi , the top Indian pick of the 2016 Auction at Rs 8.5 crore is up. Rising Pune Supergiants have opened up the bid. 
09:43 hrs IST : Saurabh Tiwary is the next player in the auction. So far, the bidding has been very cautious. He also goes unsold 
09:42 hrs IST : Alex Hales is the next player in the acution. His base price is Rs 1 crore. He goes unsold as well. Ross Taylor is the next player. He is also unsold . 
09:41 hrs IST: Faiz Fazal is up next. His base price is Rs 30 lakhs . He goes unsold. as well. 
09:40 hrs IST: Jason Roy goes unsold . 
09:38 hrs IST: Eoin Morgan is sold to Kings XIPunjab for Rs 2 crore. On his base price . 
09:37 hrs IST : Eoin Morgan is the next player in the auction. He is in the high-end of the bracket with Rs 2 crore . KXIPhave started the bid with Rs 200 lakhs 
09:36 hrs IST: Martin Guptill is the first player in the auction. His base price is Rs 50 lakhs. He goes unsold. 
09:32 hrs IST: The history of the IPLis being showed. Right from the first auction till the first match and the journey of the tournament. 
09:30 hrs IST : Rahul Johri, the BCCICEO, is giving the opening address. The IPLAuction is now open. 
09:27 hrs IST : The administrators are in attendance. All the teams are present. Ready, set go for the auction. 
09:22 hrs IST : The Committee of Administrators have come. Mahela Jayawardene sports a big smile as he enters the room. We are minutes away from the auction. This is my workplace for the rest of the day . That little gavel could be busy! #IPLAuction pic.twitter.com/Bq4mwURJqu — Richard Madley (@iplauctioneer) February 20, 2017 
09:14 hrs IST: We are only 15 minutes away from the auction. What will be the strategy of the teams? Which teams will buy aggressively? 
09:05 hrs IST : In the current line-up, KKR are still showing Andre Russell to be retained. Strange! The West Indies all-rounder has been banned for one year for violating the WADAwhereabouts clause. However, the appeal is still pending. 
08:59 hrs IST : This IPLAuction could be a low key affair. But, according to reports, there will be one notable absence. That will be the absence of the Right to Match (RTM) . Take a look at how the franchises are placed in terms of their budget. VIVO #IPLAuction to begin shortly. Stay tuned pic.twitter.com/QqvnugJwEK 
08:55 hrs IST : Looking at the composition of the teams prior to the auction, Kolkata Knight Riders are the team that might go on a big shopping spree today. They need both local and foreign players. MSDhoni was axed as the captain of Rising Pune Supergiants. (Hindustan Times) 
08:41 hrs IST : There has been some interesting news leading into the build-up of the 2017 IPLAuction. MSDhoni has been axed as captain of Rising Pune Supergiants while Mitchell Starc has ended his association with Royal Challengers Bangalore. 
08:33 hrs IST : Heading into the IPLAuction, Kings XIPunjab (Rs 23.31 cr) and Delhi Daredevils (Rs 23.1 cr) have the maximum purse while Mumbai Indians (Rs 11.5 cr) have the least purse. 
08:30 hrs IST : A warm welcome to the 2017 IPLAuction. It is that time of the year when players are traded and teams look for a fresh composition ahead of the 2017 IPL. This is the final auction before the 2018 IPL, when all the teams and players go into the auction pool. 
The 2017 IPL Auction will witness over 350 players go under the hammer. The likes of Ben Stokes, Ishant Sharma, Irfan Pathan are all expected to garner big money. With a maximum of 27 players allowed in every squad with nine overseas players, the eight franchises will be weighing their options. 
Kings XI Punjab have the highest auction purse with Rs 23.1 crore, followed by Royal Challengers Bangalore with Rs 22.8 crore. RCB have been dealt a big blow with Mitchell Starc not featuring in this IPL. Mumbai Indians have the least purse with 11.5 crores but they have the most number of players with 20. On the other hand, Kolkata Knight Riders have the least number of players in the squad with 14 and they will be eyeing a big chunk of players in the auction. 
Amongst the Indian players, the likes of Ishank Jaggi, who starred in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy and Prithvi Shaw are the big drawcards. Amongst the lesser known players, the likes of Mohammad Shehzad and Mohammad Nabi will also be the big attractions. Will the franchises be interested in them? Which Indian uncapped player will set the stage alight? All answers will be known on Monday. tags
